The export process was successfully completed.

When this mode is selected, the player is normally painted in the game, as another character of the adventure. This mode is suitable for the production of common point-and-click adventures, such as the Monkey IslandTM saga.
Panel for the configuration of conditions and effects of the button
You can define a special sound that is played when the button is activated (this improves accessibility)
Move the currently selected frame one place to the left
When reading the chapter "{#1}" the next problem was found: {#0}. Please, select what to do: 1) Delete the chapter, 2) Replace it with other file, 3) Abort process 4) Report error.
The selected file is not a XML e-Adventure chapter file.
You can define a special sound that is played when the button is activated (this improves accessibility)
This is the highlighted use-grab button, the one shown when the mouse is over it but not clicking

This is the list of variables of the chapter. Variables can be given an integer value at any moment in the game. In the game you can define conditions based on the value of the variables.

Set -> The timer will run once and again until it is stopped Not set -> The timer will run once and stop.

If the checkbox below is activated, the item will return to its original position after being dragged to a different element. If it is not checked, it will remain on the location where it was dropped.

In this case the object simulates the behaviour of a button. After a click, the first valid action of the object will be triggered. That is, the first action which conditions are met.

You have selected to create a new adventure in 3rd person mode (player is visible).\n The player is represented by an avatar, which is drawn onto the game all the time.\nIt needs some time to go from place to place, and when he speaks the text is displayed just over his head.

Use this slider to adjust the space between the page and the border of the background image
To add this type of effect, there must be at least one character in the chapter

Here you are allowed to customize the look of cursor shown when the mouse is over the exit, as well as the text displayed. Initially the default cursor is shown, and the text displayed will be the name of the scene you will get through this exit, so it is not compulsory to specify those values. However, you can customize both cursor and text for the exit (general case) and for each next scene. The text or cursor edited for the exit will only be used in case it was not customized for the next scene
You can define a special sound that is played when the button is activated (this improves accessibility)
Please note that the import process will succeed only if you selected a .ZIP file that contains an eAdventure game exported as Learning Object.\nOther ZIP files will not be imported.
The chosen .JAR is not a game exported from eAdventure.
Delete the mark to display the name of the character (or player) who says the line to all conversation lines .

This is the list of flags of the chapter. Flags can be active or inactive at any moment in the game, as traffic lights can be green or red to allow or forbid crossing. In the game you can define conditions based on the state of the flags.

Use the control below to adjust the visual transition when the image of the object varies. If the value provided (in milliseconds) is greater than zero, the images are combined for a while to make the transition softer.

In this case the object responds to mouse clicks as usual. The actions available or the description (brief) are shown on the screen, depending on the general settings of the adventure (see Adventure settings in the Menu "Adventure").
Full description of the set item
Select a scene to pick a destination point
Image for the button when the mouse is over it

You have selected to create a new adventure in 1st person mode (player is not shown). 
There is no avatar for the player.
The player explores the game himself, and transitions between scenes are instantaneous.
 Usually these games are designed using photos to configure the scenes.
Hence the playerinteracts in first person with a very real-looking world, in which you can turn or go back in the scene bi clicking left, right, down, etc.

The active areas are transparent, rectangular objects defined in the scenes. Those can be used to define portions of the scene which are interactuable. In this manner, when the mouse is over an active area the user could get some interaction from it

List of effects of the macro

Date Time must follow that pattern: AAAA[-MM[-DD[Thh[:mm[:ss[.s[IZH]]]]]]] where: AAAA=Year, expressed with 4 digits(>=0001) MM=Moth expressed with 2 digits (from 01 to 12) DD=Day expressed with 2 digits (from 01 to 31) hh=Hour expressed with 2 digits (from 00 to 23)(am/pm it is not allowed) mm=Minute expressed with 2 digits (from 00 to 59) ss=Seconds expressed with 2 digits (from 00 to 59) s=One or more digits for second tenth Time Zone identifier (âZâ for UTC or +hh:mm or âhh:mm)

When the same group of conditions are going to be used together more than once it is better to define them as "Global States". Then you can refer to them in any conditions block without introducing all the conditions again.

To make correct LOMES Contribute's entry follow next indications: When "Contribute Type" is âCreatorâ, the next value must appear in "Contribute Entity": BEGIN:VCARD VERSION 3.0 FN: EMAIL;TYPE=INTERNET:ORG: "Company name" END:VCARD Note: "Company name" must be a non empty value, representing the name of company which privides this educational content.
When "Contribute Type" is âValidatorâ, the next value must appear in "Contribute Entity": BEGIN:VCARD VERSION 3.0 FN:Contenido digital educativo creado, catalogado y financiado con fondos FEDER dentro del expediente 714/07-LoteX EMAIL;TYPE=INTERNET:sugerencias@red.es ORG:RED.ES END:VCARD

To make correct LOMES Identifier's entry follow next indications: administration(abbreviation in lower case)_creation date(yearmonthday)_agregation level_nÂº of object, at least 7 digits(number smaller that 10.000.000)-meta
Note: "-meta" suffix is only required for Identifier in MetaMetaData
Example: es-ex_20061017_2_1300009-meta
Abbreviation for any spanish public administration(MEC, RED.ES, etc.) : es
Abbreviation for States (must carry "es" abbreviation):
es-an AndalucÃ­a es-ib Islas Baleares / Illes Balears es-ar AragÃ³n es-lr La Rioja es-cl Castilla y LeÃ³n es-ma Comunidad de Madrid es-cm CastillaâLa Mancha es-mu RegiÃ³n de Murcia es-ic Canarias es-na Navarra / Nafarroa es-ct CataluÃ±a/Catalunya es-as Principado de Asturias es-ex Extremadura es-eu PaÃ­s Vasco / Euskadi es-ga Galicia es-cb Cantabria es-cv Comunidad Valenciana / Comunitat Valenciana

To make correct LOMES Contribute's entry follow next indications: When "Contribute Type" is âContent Providerâ, the next value must appear in "Contribute Entity": BEGIN:VCARD VERSION 3.0 FN: EMAIL;TYPE=INTERNET:ORG: "Company name" END:VCARD Note: "Company name" must be a non empty value, representing the name of company which privides this educational content.
When "Contribute Type" is âPublisherâ, the next value must appear in "Contribute Entity": BEGIN:VCARD VERSION 3.0 FN:Contenido digital educativo creado, catalogado y financiado con fondos FEDER dentro del expediente 714/07-LoteX EMAIL;TYPE=INTERNET:sugerencias@red.es ORG:RED.ES END:VCARD
When "Contribute Type" has other values, the next value must appear in "Contribute Entity": BEGIN:VCARD VERSION:3.0 FN: "Title" EMAIL;TYPE=INTERNET: "example@yourmail.com" ORG: "Organization" END:VCARD Note: "Title", "example@yourmail.com" and "Organization" can be any value, even empty.

Welcome to the eAdventure editor! To get started using the editor you must choose between the options prompted here. You can create a new file by clicking on the button you can find below. You are allowed to create two different type of adventure games (this choice can be modified later): - Adventures where the player is shown normally, as for instance, the MonkeyIslandTM saga (3rd person mode). - Adventures where the player is not shown, giving the impression that the user is directly inside the game, as in the Myst saga (1st person mode).
If you do not want to create a new adventure project, you can open an existing one by browsing the tabs above.

Please notice that auto-save, save-on-suspend and restore-after-open features will be ignored in editor playback to simplify debugging. If you want the game to be saved, just use the Exit menu in game.
Toggles the display of the save/load buttons in the Exit in-game menu.
Toggles the display of the reset button in the Exit in-game menu.
Auto-save makes the game to be saved after an effects block is executed.

Save on suspend saves the game when the player loses focus on the game window. This is mainly useful in handheld devices where the game can be accidentally closed and you want to maintain the game state.

Restore after open loads the last save game right after the game is opened. When used in combination with save on suspend it creates the experience that the game runs continuously, despite of being closed.
Main Scene was not found! Please open \"_Scene1\" in scenes folder before playing the game.
